titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Walter Kaufmann, 1959-1965, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Alyssa Mertka

note.p: Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:17:09 -0500.

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content to create sections for abstract, bioghist, controlaccess, scopecontent, acquisitioninfo, and levels for container list were applied. Madison Chartier

did.abstract: The Kaufmann mss., 1959-1965, consists of a photoreproduction of the complete orchestra score and libretto for The Scarlet Letter (1961), and the first draft, complete score, and photoreproduction of A Hoosier Tale (1966), two operas by composer and conductor Walter Kaufmann, 1907-1984.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Walter Kaufmann, 1907-1984, was a composer, conductor, and musical educator, born under the Austro-Hungarian Empire in 1907. His work was known internationally, and he traveled throughout Europe, India, and North America with his music before settling in Bloomington, Indiana to work at the Indiana University Bloomington School of Music in 1957. He became a naturalized U.S. citizen in 1964. Some of his signature works include his opera based off Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel, The Scarlet Letter (1961), and the opening theme for All India Radio. Kaufmann passed away in 1984.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Kaufmann mss., 1959-1965, consists of a photoreproduction of the complete orchestra score and libretto for The Scarlet Letter, and the first draft, complete score, and photoreproduction of A Hoosier Tale, two operas by composer and conductor Walter Kaufmann, 1907-1984.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Kaufmann mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
